subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: From the cursive script form of {{zh-l|*閻}}. {{zh-l|闫}} was adopted as the simplified form of {{zh-l|*閻}} in the {{w|second round of simplified Chinese characters}}.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: From {{zh-l|*閻}}. After the retraction of the second round of simplification in Mainland China, some people have continued to use {{zh-l|闫}} as their surname, but others have changed it to {{zh-l|阎}}, separating the two variants of the same surname into two different surnames.
